value.title: Create heatmaps without custom visuals in Power BI
value.excerpt: Quick tip for today: I will show you how to create a heatmap in Power BI without downloading a custom visual.   This can be useful if your organization does not allow you to use custom visuals.   Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center  SUBSCRIBE to learn more about

value.title: Custom sort order for axis, columns, legends.... in Power BI
value.excerpt: How do I sort och change the default order for columns, axis, legends in Power BI?  I get this question all the time, and although I have already explained it in other videos, I don't have a specific video for it and your questions hint me that is needed. value.title: DAX Fridays! #105: ISINSCOPE
value.excerpt: The DAX function ISINSCOPE, allow us to work with hierarchies in Power BI. In this video I will go through an example on how to do that. This DAX function was introduced in the November 2018 Power BI Desktop Update, so make sure you have that installed if you wan to test it out.  Other resources:  DAX

value.title: DAX Fridays! #112: Remove blanks from hierarchies with ISINSCOPE
value.excerpt: In today's video I am going to show you how you can remove blanks from hierarchies using the DAX Function ISINSCOPE.  I have covered ISINSCOPE before with a more difficult example, so I hope this video will explain it in easier terms and with a useful example.  Link to the previous ISINSCOPE video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sSUCyps_1O4

value.title: DAX Fridays! #183: How to deal with multiple dates in Power BI
value.excerpt: So you have order date, shipped date, required date....and only one calendar. How do you manage that in power bi and DAX?  This scenario is often called role playing dimensions and in this video I will show you two ways to solve it. :) Happy Friday!!  Links to videos mentioned: Introduction to data modeling:

value.title: DAX Fridays! #21: USERELATIONSHIP
value.excerpt: A common example in a Power BI table is to have multiple dates, which are related to the same Date table. As you are limited to one active relationship, we need to use the DAX function USERELATIONSHIP to manage the inactive relationships.  Link to Power BI file: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/userelationship-dax

value.title: DAX Fridays! #7: ALL, ALLEXCEPT
value.excerpt: The function ALL returns all the rows in a table, or all the values in a column, ignoring any filters that might have been applied. This function is useful for clearing filters and creating calculations on all the rows in a table.  The function ALLEXCEPT removes all filters except the ones that have

value.title: Differences between Power BI Apps and Workspaces
value.excerpt: In today's video I am going to show you the difference between Power Bi Apps and workspaces and what do I use them for. I also explain why I think that workspaces are too messy for the business user or data consumer.  Links to resources mentioned in the video: The new App Navigation video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Bo0HHUcuas

value.title: Disable refresh in Power Bi for local sources and more   ...
